name: JD Vance
bio: JD Vance is the 50th Vice President of the United States. He previously served as U.S. Senator from Ohio (2023–2025) and is the author of 'Hillbilly Elegy.'
education: Ohio State University (BA), Yale Law School (JD)
platform: Working-class revival, tech accountability, cultural conservatism, border enforcement.

platformFollowThrough.Working-Class Revival: Promoted trade reform and domestic manufacturing incentives.
platformFollowThrough.Tech Accountability: Supported antitrust scrutiny of Big Tech.
platformFollowThrough.Border Enforcement: Advocated for Title 42 reinstatement and ICE funding.

name: Marco Rubio
bio: Marco Rubio is the 71st U.S. Secretary of State. He served as U.S. Senator from Florida (2011–2025) and Speaker of the Florida House (2006–2008).
education: University of Florida (BA), University of Miami (JD)
platform: Strengthen alliances, counter China, prioritize Western Hemisphere security.

platformFollowThrough.Latin America: Reopened dialogues with Colombia and Brazil.

name: Scott Bessent
bio: Scott Bessent is the 78th U.S. Secretary of the Treasury. He is a financier, former CIO at Soros Fund Management, and founder of Key Square Group.
platform: Fiscal discipline, pro-growth tax policy, strong dollar.

name: Pete Hegseth
bio: Pete Hegseth is the 29th U.S. Secretary of Defense. He is a former Army National Guard officer and Fox News commentator.
platform: Military readiness, veterans support, modernization.

name: Pam Bondi
bio: Pam Bondi is the 86th Attorney General of the United States. She previously served as Florida Attorney General (2011–2019).
education: University of Florida (BA), Stetson University College of Law (JD)
platform: Law and order, anti-corruption, immigration enforcement.

platformFollowThrough.Immigration: Directed DOJ to prioritize border cases.
platformFollowThrough.Anti-Corruption: Launched task force on federal ethics violations.

name: Doug Burgum
bio: Doug Burgum is the 53rd Secretary of the Interior. He previously served as Governor of North Dakota (2016–2024).
education: North Dakota State University (BA), Stanford University (MBA)
platform: Energy development, land management reform.

platformFollowThrough.Energy: Approved new drilling leases on federal land.

name: Brooke Rollins
bio: Brooke Rollins is the 33rd Secretary of Agriculture. She previously served as acting director of the Domestic Policy Council under President Trump and as CEO of the Texas Public Policy Foundation.
education: Texas A&M University (BA), University of Texas School of Law (JD)
platform: Rural development, deregulation, and agricultural innovation.

platformFollowThrough.Deregulation: Rolled back Obama‑era farm reporting rules.

name: Howard Lutnick
bio: Howard Lutnick is the 41st Secretary of Commerce. He is CEO of Cantor Fitzgerald and has decades of experience in financial services and markets.
platform: Trade expansion, deregulation, and pro‑business growth.

platformFollowThrough.Trade: Opened talks on new bilateral trade deals.

name: Lori Chavez-DeRemer
bio: Lori Chavez-DeRemer is the 30th Secretary of Labor. She previously served as U.S. Representative for Oregon’s 5th district (2023–2025) and as mayor of Happy Valley, Oregon.
platform: Workforce training, union reform, and deregulation.

platformFollowThrough.Union Reform: Proposed new transparency rules for unions.

name: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
office: Secretary of Health and Human Services
bio: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is the 31st Secretary of Health and Human Services. He is an environmental lawyer and activist, known for his work on water quality and vaccine policy.
education: Harvard College (BA), University of Virginia (JD), Pace University (LLM)
platform: Medical freedom, regulatory reform, environmental health.

platformFollowThrough.Medical Freedom: Ordered review of vaccine approval processes.

name: Scott Turner
office: Secretary of Housing and Urban Development
bio: Scott Turner is the 19th Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. He is a former NFL player, Texas legislator, and executive director of the White House Opportunity and Revitalization Council.
platform: Urban revitalization, affordable housing, opportunity zones.

name: Sean Duffy
bio: Sean Duffy is the 20th Secretary of Transportation. He previously served as U.S. Representative for Wisconsin’s 7th district (2011–2019) and as a television commentator.
platform: Infrastructure modernization, deregulation, and rural connectivity.

name: Chris Wright
bio: Chris Wright is the 17th Secretary of Energy. He is CEO of Liberty Energy and a longtime advocate for domestic energy production.
platform: Energy independence, fossil fuel expansion, deregulation.

platformFollowThrough.Energy Independence: Approved new oil and gas leases.

name: Linda McMahon
bio: Linda McMahon is the 12th Secretary of Education. She previously served as Administrator of the Small Business Administration (2017–2019) and is co-founder of WWE.
platform: School choice, vocational training, rollback of federal mandates.

name: Doug Collins
bio: Doug Collins is the 12th Secretary of Veterans Affairs. He previously served as U.S. Representative for Georgia’s 9th district (2013–2021).
education: University of North Georgia (BA), New Orleans Baptist Theological Seminary (MDiv), John Marshall Law School (JD)
platform: Veterans healthcare reform, accountability, modernization.

name: Kristi Noem
bio: Kristi Noem is the 8th Secretary of Homeland Security. She previously served as Governor of South Dakota (2019–2025) and as U.S. Representative (2011–2019).
platform: Border security, immigration enforcement, counterterrorism.

name: Lee Zeldin
office: Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency
bio: Lee Zeldin is the 16th Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency. He previously served as U.S. Representative for New York’s 1st district (2015–2023) and was the Republican nominee for Governor of New York in 2022.
platform: Balance environmental protection with economic growth.

platformFollowThrough.Regulation: Scaled back climate regulations on energy producers.
platformFollowThrough.Water Quality: Announced new clean water infrastructure grants.

name: Russell Vought
office: Director of the Office of Management and Budget
bio: Russell Vought is the Director of the Office of Management and Budget. He previously served in the same role from 2020–2021 and is president of the Center for Renewing America.
platform: Fiscal restraint, budget transparency, and regulatory review.

name: Tulsi Gabbard
bio: Tulsi Gabbard is the 8th Director of National Intelligence. She previously served as U.S. Representative for Hawaii’s 2nd district (2013–2021) and as a major in the Hawaii Army National Guard.
platform: Intelligence reform, counterterrorism, and cybersecurity.

platformFollowThrough.Reform: Ordered review of inter‑agency intelligence sharing.
platformFollowThrough.Cybersecurity: Launched new cyber defense task force.

name: Jamieson Greer
bio: Jamieson Greer is the 20th U.S. Trade Representative. He previously served as Chief of Staff to USTR Robert Lighthizer and as an international trade attorney.
education: Brigham Young University (BA), George Washington University Law School (JD)
platform: Fair trade, tariffs on adversaries, and reshoring supply chains.

platformFollowThrough.Tariffs: Imposed new tariffs on Chinese imports.

name: Kelly Loeffler
office: Administrator of the Small Business Administration
bio: Kelly Loeffler is the 27th Administrator of the Small Business Administration. She previously served as U.S. Senator from Georgia (2020–2021) and as a financial executive.
platform: Small business growth, deregulation, and capital access.

name: Susie Wiles
bio: Susie Wiles is the White House Chief of Staff. She is a longtime Republican strategist and senior advisor to Donald Trump’s campaigns.
platform: Streamline White House operations, strengthen political strategy.

name: Karoline Leavitt
bio: Karoline Leavitt is the 36th White House Press Secretary, appointed in 2025 under President Donald Trump. At age 27, she became the youngest person to serve in the role. She previously worked as a presidential speechwriter, communications director for Rep. Elise Stefanik, and was the Republican nominee for New Hampshire’s 1st congressional district in 2022.
education: Saint Anselm College (BA in Politics and Communication)
platform: Transparent communication of administration priorities, strong defense of the President’s agenda, and rapid response to media narratives.

platformFollowThrough.Transparency: Instituted daily on‑camera briefings from day one.
platformFollowThrough.Agenda Defense: Aggressively promoted administration policies on border security and economic nationalism.
platformFollowThrough.Rapid Response: Built a streamlined comms team to counter breaking news cycles.
